p.ph: The maximum dimensions of encoding the shared region.
The video encoding resolution of the shared screen stream.
On Windows and macOS, it represents the video encoding resolution of the shared screen stream.
See . The default value is 1920 x 1080, that is, 2,073,600 pixels. Agora uses the value of this parameter to calculate the charges.

pd.p:
If the aspect ratio is different between the encoding dimensions and screen dimensions, Agora applies the following algorithms for encoding. Suppose dimensionsvideoDimensions are 1920 x 1080:
If the value of the screen dimensions is lower than that of dimensionsvideoDimensions, for example, 1000 x 1000 pixels, the SDK uses 1000 x 1000 pixels for encoding.
If the value of the screen dimensions is higher than that of dimensionsvideoDimensions, for example, 2000 x 1500, the SDK uses the maximum value under dimensionsvideoDimensions with the aspect ratio of the screen dimension (4:3) for encoding, that is, 1440 x 1080.

pd.ph: The frame rate of the shared region.
The video encoding resolution of the shared screen stream.
On Windows and macOS, it represents the video encoding frame rate (fps) of the shared screen stream.
The frame rate (fps) of the shared region. The default value is 5. We do not recommend setting this to a value greater than 15.
The bitrate of the shared region.
The video encoding bitrate of the shared screen stream.
On Windows and macOS, it represents the video encoding bitrate of the shared screen stream.
The bitrate (Kbps) of the shared region. The default value is 0 (the SDK works out a bitrate according to the dimensions of the current screen).

A list of IDs of windows to be blocked. When calling to start screen sharing, you can use this parameter to block a specified window. When calling to update screen sharing configurations, you can use this parameter to dynamically block the specified windows during screen sharing.
